content.text:
# List of libraries in 19th-century New York City

This list includes libraries located in New York City active in the 19th century. Included are public libraries, academic libraries, medical libraries, church libraries, government libraries, circulating libraries, and subscription libraries.
Spingler Institute, Union Square, 19th century]]

References
Further reading
*
* E. Porter Belden. "Literature, Science, and Taste." [https://books.google.com/books?id=Jv-nXd8W8b0C New York, past, present, and future]: comprising a history of the city of New York, a description of its present condition, and an estimate of its future increase. NY: Putnam, 1849
* Libraries in New York City. [https://books.google.com/books?id=Zu4QAAAAIAAJ Norton's Literary and Educational Register for 1854].
* "New York (City): Free Circulating Libraries." [https://books.google.com/books?id=o4oEAAAAYAAJ American annual cyclopaedia and register of important events of the year 1886]. NY: Appleton & Co., 1889
* "Libraries and Reading Rooms." [https://books.google.com/books?id=MEEAAAAAYAAJ King's handbook of New York City], 2nd ed. 1893.
* "Libraries of New York." James Grant Wilson. The memorial history of the City of New-York: from its first settlement to the year 1892, [https://books.google.com/books?id=2u0TAAAAYAAJ Volume 4]. New York History Co., 1893
* [https://books.google.com/books?id=2qM9AAAAYAAJ Statistics of New York Libraries for 1894]. State Library Bulletin, June 1895
* "Libraries in New York City." [https://books.google.com/books?id=SK8UAAAAYAAJ Public Libraries] 1:7, Nov. 1896
* "Libraries of the City of New York." [https://books.google.com/books?id=VFdFAAAAYAAJ Libraries of Greater New York]. NY: New York Library Club, 1902
* Hedbavny, L. "Some Leisure-Time Organizations in New York City, 1830-1870: Clubs, Lyceums, and Libraries." Master's thesis, New York University, 1952.
* Harold Augenbraum. New York's Oldest Public Libraries. RBM 1 no2 (2000), 145-60
* T. Glynn. [https://etd.auburn.edu/handle/10415/736 Books in the public sphere: New York libraries and the culture-building enterprise (dissertation)]. Auburn University, NY.
